greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest number obtainable by permuting the exponents in the prime factorization of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)); f[,2]=vecsort(f[,2],,4); factorback(f) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015
results.author: _Sam Alexander_, Dec 11 2003
